body: Hi All, I am using Ladybug_ShadingDesigner to define overhang for a window. I tried to use shading designer from [this](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Shading_Designer&slide=0&scale=8&offset=-6069.575758411403,-1910.3967672448712) hydra example. What I'm with is getting my context recognized. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SVnC9W7SBKSpGzS*m1812zrHmsU16TD85lf4Fpd9B9zitkqCGLH123ysj8AeqpsPR3NQj14kXB787TOnBc-fdYjmiUSJ81e4/ShadingDesigner.JPG) I believe the shading generated is not being influenced by the context geometry that I am supplying. Can anybody suggest what I am missing here? Any help is appreciated. Thank you! -Devang
topic: Shading Designer Context not being recognized

replies.body:
Hi Devang,
I think you can solve your problem in this way: 1) you should make something like in the screenshot below. This is because of MeshRay component. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lRmMARtgbReab2tHXzyUh3mBWFdK3MZqTlCPDf3XsjTx9anQ4pn8GwZMlS42zVcxrYdLGfd-wRa6OuzBsZnuGRI4eoah-MBo/testPoints.PNG) 2) basically "4 true" means that the window is obstructed. So you should use "<" instead "<=" and move a bit your obstruction to leave sufficient space to rays which comes from vertices of the window. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lRmMARtgbRfEDAXxKZk4koF-cD5du20VTiPT76gP5bPaF3*m4oLveG3GEWldnxp1R9CXMWxJJ72cjFYYFRLZItjV13o6gaoJ/concept.PNG)
Best,
Antonello

It reminds me something we are cooking Antonello ... :-)

-A.

Hi Abraham,

I would be interested in what you both are collaborating on.

Thanks,

-Devang

Hi Antonello, Thank you for looking into this. I understand what you're saying. However, I am still struggling with this. I receive True values for all the intersections, which does not seem right. I also changed the context so that some rays can directly hit the corner points of the window. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/BDuwXwZXcryEut9W35dnvESbMzAAWdlmzR879h-v3bZy*WKdltvCUohAtvcCDOIPDGMCq59oTTpNBSpp-dVdIQLLORnaSWOY/shadingDesigner.png) However, I still get the same result. I have attached the file again. Is it the case that this is happening on my machine only? Does it work fine at your end?
I am wondering if there's something wrong with my GH definition or should I dig deeper into the code for this one. Thank you!
-Devang

Hi Devang,



I forgot to tell you that you need to make a hole in the building. Check geometries in attached file ;)



Best,

Antonello

Thanks a lot, Antonello,



For now, it works. This was a simplified version of a model that I am working on. I believe the SunShade component that you're developing in collaboration with Abraham will be of more help.



Thank you!

Devang
